content: As an AI language model, I cannot provide personalized recommendations, but in general, it's recommended to have a balanced workout routine that includes both cardio and strength training. The American College of Sports Medicine suggests that adults should aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic exercise each week, plus two or more days of strength training. However, the specific amounts of cardio and strength training will depend on your fitness goals, current fitness level, and any underlying health conditions you may have. It's always best to consult with a qualified fitness professional to create a workout plan tailored to your individual needs.
